{"step_by_step_thinking": "Protein precipitation is a method used to concentrate and purify proteins from a solution. This can be done by several methods including adding trichloroacetic acid as mentioned in Document [16], adjusting the pH to the isoelectric point as mentioned in Document [12], and adding salts of heavy metals as mentioned in Document [29]. However, there is no mention in the documents of using acetyl alcohol and acetone for protein precipitation.", "answer_choice": "B"}
